abstract: Creates a listener for apps that listen for connections from a network device picker.
overview:
## Discussion

Use this initializer to setup a listener for application services.

Apps that register as advertising an application service should always have a listener waiting for a local connection. The system launches your app when the user selects the current device in a [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/DeviceDiscoveryUI/DevicePicker] or [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/DeviceDiscoveryUI/DDDevicePickerViewController]. Create the listener as soon as your app launches, so that your app can connect with the requesting device.

# init(applicationService:)

**Initializer**

Creates a listener for apps that listen for connections from a network device picker.

## Declaration

```swift
init(applicationService: String)
```

## Parameters

- **applicationService**: The name of the application service. This must match the name passed to the network device picker.

## Discussion

Use this initializer to setup a listener for application services.

Apps that register as advertising an application service should always have a listener waiting for a local connection. The system launches your app when the user selects the current device in a [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/DeviceDiscoveryUI/DevicePicker] or [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/DeviceDiscoveryUI/DDDevicePickerViewController]. Create the listener as soon as your app launches, so that your app can connect with the requesting device.
title: init(applicationService:)
